title: I Tried Keoni CBD Gummies—Here's My Honest Review
description: I Tried Keoni CBD Gummies—Here's My Honest Review
content:
Keoni CBD gummies are made with 100% organically grown, domestically-sourced hemp. Although the product label says the gummies are “full spectrum,” the contents of the product itself seems to be more in line with the industry description of a broad-spectrum CBD product (meaning it goes through an additional process to remove THC). If you’re taking any prescription medications or dietary supplements, be sure to consult with your health care provider before trying Keoni CBD Gummies or any other product containing CBD. We receive compensation from our partners for Featured Partner Offer placements. While this may influence where their products or services appear on our site, it in no way affects our ratings, which are based on thorough research, solid methodologies and expert advice. Our partners cannot pay us to guarantee favorable review of their products or services.
• Third-party laboratory tested for quality and potency, with certificates of analysis (COAs) easily accessible on the product website
• Made with 100% organically-grown hemp, according to the company
• Each gummy contains 25 milligrams of full-spectrum CBD, according to the product label (although the website says each gummy contains 20 milligrams of CBD). Keoni CBD offers a variety of CBD products, including gummies, capsules and oils. According to the Keoni website, small-town values are the heart of the business, which strives to provide exceptional customer service and quality products. Strong hemp flavor may not be appealing to some consumers May cause side effects, including dry mouth, drowsiness, gastrointestinal upset or lightheadedness THC-free, according to the product’s COA on the Keoni website Should not be taken with certain medications or supplements (check with a health care provider first)

Keoni CBD Gummies claim to feature full-spectrum CBD, which means they also contain other cannabinoids, terpenes and flavonoids present in the hemp plant. Because Keoni’s CBD blend is extracted directly from the hemp plant and further isolated and tested to ensure it doesn’t contain THC, it actually seems to be a broad-spectrum blend per industry standards. The human body naturally produces compounds called endocannabinoids, which are very similar to the cannabinoids found in the hemp plant, says Bridget Williams, M.D., a board-certified family physician and the CEO at Green Harvest Health in Pickerington, Ohio. Such compounds help achieve homeostasis in the body, playing a role in a variety of functions, such as sleep, mood, appetite, memory and fertility, says Dr. Williams. Over time, genetics, stress and lifestyle choices can cause us to become deficient in these compounds, leading to what some researchers are calling endocannabinoid deficiency disorder, according to a theory introduced by Ethan Russo M.D., director of research and development at the International Cannabis and Cannabinoids Institute . Symptoms like anxiety and insomnia may indicate an unbalanced endocannabinoid system, says Dr. Williams. “CBD can help restore our endocannabinoids, repair receptors and thus help restore balance via the endocannabinoid system,” says Dr. Williams. In fact, research suggests CBD can improve anxiety and depression, pain and inflammation, and other medical conditions, including arthritis, multiple sclerosis and epilepsy . “I don’t usually use CBD as part of a general wellness routine for happy, healthy people because I assume they have properly functioning endocannabinoid systems,” says David Berger, M.D., a board-certified pediatrician at Wholistic Pediatrics and Family Care in Tampa, Florida. However, he says he utilizes CBD frequently with patients who have mental and behavioral health issues, seizures, movement disorders and hyper-inflammatory and autoimmune conditions.

How Much Do Keoni CBD Gummies Cost? One bottle of 20 gummies containing a total of 500 milligrams of CBD (25 milligrams per gummy) costs $54.99 ($44.99 with the subscribe-and-save option), and a bottle of 40 gummies containing a total of 1,000 milligrams of CBD (25 milligrams per gummy) costs $64.99 ($54.99 with the subscribe-and-save option). CBD gummies with additional ingredients, including Delta-8 THC or Delta-9 THC and a sleep-promoting CBD blend are also available on the Keoni website. In addition to CBD gummies, Keoni sells a variety of CBD oils, capsules, topical creams, gels, roll-ons and sprays, including bundled items. All products are available at a discount when you choose the subscribe-and-save option for monthly delivery (discounts vary by product).

To use Keoni’s products, you must be over the age of 18, and the company recommends incorporating CBD into a wellness routine consisting of regular exercise, balanced nutrition and self-care. Results may vary based on your age, overall health and family history, and you should seek the advice of a health care provider before using any supplement, including Keoni CBD gummies, according to the company website. While Keoni claims simplicity is one of its values, its website presents some conflicting information. For example, it discusses the differences between broad-spectrum CBD, full-spectrum CBD, CBD isolate and CBD distillate, but it’s unclear how THC has been removed from its full-spectrum CBD gummies (full-spectrum hemp usually contains trace amounts of THC not exceeding federal regulations of .3% by dry weight). Furthermore, there’s very little information available about the company itself, including where the products are manufactured and who owns and runs the company and its operations.
• Original Mixed Berry Gummies are vegan-friendly and free from GMOs
• 50mg of CBD & 5mg of melatonin per serving
• Original Mixed Berry Gummies are vegan-friendly and free from GMOs
• 50mg of CBD & 5mg of melatonin per serving

What Experts Have To Say About Keoni CBD Gummies Gummies are a great option for using CBD due to their ease of use, says Dr. Williams. Gummies usually taste great, travel well, can be cut easily to adjust the dose and are discreet and convenient, she says. “Because the half-life for CBD gummies is longer than inhalation or [oil] drops, they can better address sleep issues, generalized anxiety issues and chronic pain than [delivery methods] that are eliminated from the body faster,” says Dr. Williams. “Being a CBD specialist who provides doctor approvals for products, I look for CBD options that have excellent third-party tested COAs” says Dr. Williams. Testing is crucial, along with evenly distributed cannabinoids throughout the gummy (versus being sprayed on top), she says, adding that Keoni appears to be a brand that works hard to create a high-quality CBD product in a competitive and unregulated market. However, Dr. Berger points out that the COAs on Keoni’s website are more than a year old, which could be problematic. “In my practice, I only recommend products from companies that test each batch for impurities and labeling accuracy and who willingly make these results publicly available,” he says. Because Keoni CBD is a retail company that anyone can access, there’s no oversight when it comes to who’s taking the supplements, with what medications and at what dose, says Erica Steele, a naturopathic doctor at Holistic Family Practice in Virginia Beach, Virginia. “I always pause with [direct-to-consumer brands] simply because they can be harmful for people with various biochemical challenges—for example, those who suffer from depression, are neurodivergent or are currently on psychotropic medications that may interact with CBD,” says Dr. Steele. That said, there aren’t fillers included in the Keoni CBD gummy ingredient list, and they contain a relatively low dose of CBD, says Dr. Steele. “I would not recommend it as a therapeutic product, but more so a preventative one—as long as there’s oversight from a qualified health care provider,” she says. We receive compensation from our partners for Featured Partner Offer placements. While this may influence where their products or services appear on our site, it in no way affects our ratings, which are based on thorough research, solid methodologies and expert advice. Our partners cannot pay us to guarantee favorable review of their products or services.
• No more than 0.3% hemp-derived THC by weight

I experienced a mild relaxing effect from taking Keoni CBD Gummies. I noticed about 45 minutes after consuming a gummy that I was more mindful than usual as I prepared dinner for the evening. Rather than rushing through the task, I felt more present—most likely a result of reduced anxiety. I also slept soundly that night, with no residual grogginess the next day. The instructions on the container say to take one gummy with a meal. I observed that taking them during the workday made me feel less productive, so I decided to stick with evening use. Overall, I found the gummies to be a good way to unwind and promote an enhanced state of calm at the end of a busy day. Out of 104 Trustpilot reviews, Keoni CBD has an average rating of 2.9 out of five stars. One self-described light sleeper said the gummies were effectively sleep-promoting. Less satisfied customers complained about customer service and issues with shipping and refunds. Keoni CBD is not accredited by the Better Business Bureau and has an F rating, with an average customer rating of one out of five stars. Most complaints were due to issues regarding canceling subscriptions and obtaining product refunds. Forbes Health covers CBD and cannabis products in accordance with FTC guidelines. Learn more about Forbes Health’s practices and policies regarding how we cover CBD and cannabis as a publisher.
summary: Keoni CBD gummies are made with 100% organically grown, domestically-sourced hemp and contain a broad-spectrum CBD product. The product label states that the product is a "full spectrum" product, which undergoes an additional process to remove THC. If you're taking any prescription medications or dietary supplements, consult with your health care provider before using these products. The company also offers a variety of CBD products, including gummies, capsules, and oils. Despite strong hemp flavor, these products may cause side effects such as dry mouth, drowsiness, gastrointestinal upset or lightheadedness. Keoni's CBD blend is extracted directly from the hemp plant and further isolated and tested to ensure it doesn't contain THC, it actually seems to be a broad spectrum blend per industry standards.
shortSummary: Keoni CBD Gummies, made with 100% hemp, offer promising CBD products but warn against over-the-countering potential side effects from certain medications or supplements.

scraped_sources.text:
Table of Contents
As the cannabidiol (CBD) market expands and evolves, so does the number of products on the shelf—and it can quickly get overwhelming. The main types of CBD you’ll come across are full spectrum, broad spectrum and CBD isolate. Each one has its own makeup and potential benefits, depending on what you’re looking for. Knowing the key differences between them can help you choose the option that best supports your personal wellness goals.
Full spectrum, broad spectrum and isolate refer to types of cannabis extracts that indicate how many of the original hemp plant’s compounds are included in the final product. All forms of CBD have pros and cons, and understanding those differences can make a big impact in how well a product works for you.
Forbes Health covers CBD and cannabis products in accordance with FTC guidelines. Learn more about Forbes Health’s practices and policies regarding how we cover CBD and cannabis as a publisher.
What Are the Three Types of CBD?
CBD, cannabinol (CBN) and cannabigerol (CBG) are three unique cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant, each with their own standout traits and potential benefits.
Full-spectrum CBD contains all extracts of the cannabis or hemp plant, including delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), a psychoactive cannabinoid chemical, in legal amounts under 0.3%. These compounds work together in what’s known as the “entourage effect,” a theory that suggests CBD may be more effective when all cannabis compounds are combined rather than isolated.
Broad-spectrum CBD contains all the same cannabinoids, terpenes (what makes certain cannabis plants smell or taste different from others) and compounds as full-spectrum, but the THC is almost completely extracted.
Isolate CBD is a purified form of cannabidiol, typically 99% or more. It contains no other compounds from the hemp plant, and is therefore unlikely to appear on a drug test for THC.
What Form of CBD Is Most Effective?
Current research suggests that full spectrum CBD may be the most effective form for many users due to what some people call the “entourage effect.” The combined effects of CBD and THC can offer users a higher level of relief for their symptoms, especially pain.
Research also indicates that full-spectrum products may produce increased effectiveness of CBD due to greater bioavailability and systemic exposure. Bioavailability is the percentage of CBD that actually enters your bloodstream and becomes active in your body, and varies between individuals.
However, effectiveness ultimately depends on individual factors, including sensitivity to THC, desired therapeutic outcomes and personal tolerance levels. Broad spectrum CBD offers benefits from the entourage effect just as full spectrum CBD does, while avoiding THC-related or drug testing concerns.
Retailers offer CBD in a variety of forms, including:
- CBD oils and tinctures. These can take action faster than edibles, since users typically place the oil or tincture under the tongue before swallowing. This allows the CBD to be absorbed through the sublingual blood vessels, which results in a much quicker onset of effects since digestion doesn’t delay absorption.
- Capsules, pills and edibles like CBD gummies. Edibles have long-lasting effects and come in pre-measured doses. Onset of effects can be slightly delayed; diet and digestive factors can influence absorption.
- Topical creams and balms. These are applied directly to the skin, typically to target localized discomfort, inflammation or muscle soreness. They work on a localized level by interacting with cannabinoid receptors in the skin.
- Inhalation methods, like vaping or smoking. While this method is fast-acting and typically used to treat acute symptoms, it’s not recommended for anyone with lung conditions or sensitivities.
- CBD-infused beverages. These are easy to incorporate into your daily routine or social life, however dosing can be inconsistent depending on the brand or formulation.
What Is the Difference Between CBD, CBN and CBG?
CBD, CBN and CBG are three unique cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant. Here’s how they differ:
- CBD (cannabidiol) is perhaps the most well-known and studied. It’s commonly used to ease anxiety, promote relaxation, support sleep and reduce discomfort.
- CBN (cannabinol) forms when THC is exposed to heat and light over time and is not produced directly by the plant. Although CBN shows promise in offering users sleep benefits, additional high-quality research is needed.
- CBG (cannabigerol) is often called the “mother cannabinoid” because it’s the compound from which many other cannabinoids are formed, including CBD and THC. CBG is best known for easing inflammation, making it a go-to for daytime use.
How To Choose a CBD Product
When choosing a CBD product, potential users need to consider several critical factors to ensure they select a safe, effective and appropriate option.
Safety and quality
Users should look for CBD companies that are Certified Organic on the USDA website and ensure the product has a certificate of analysis (COA) from an independent, certified laboratory. These lab reports verify potency, confirm the absence of harmful contaminants like pesticides and heavy metals, and validate that THC levels comply with legal limits.
Check the Label
When checking a CBD product label, start by identifying what type of CBD is in the product: full spectrum, broad spectrum or isolate. Next, review the ingredient list for transparency and quality.
All required label statements must be placed on the front label panel or on the information panel . The FDA has specific label requirements for CBD products. Contents of labels must include the following information[1]:
- Statement of the supplement’s identity
- Quantity of contents in the container
- Nutrition labeling
- Ingredient list
- Manufacturer’s name and place of business
Check Brand Reviews
Checking brand reviews is an important step when choosing a CBD product because it gives you real-world insight into how the product performs and how the company treats its customers. Reviews from confirmed users can reveal whether the product delivers on its promises by meeting consumer needs. Consumers can find trustworthy brand reviews at third-party review websites, retailer websites, e-commerce platforms, industry-specific directories, consumer advocacy outlets and social media or online forums.
In addition, reviews can shed light on the company’s transparency and customer service. With so many CBD brands on the market, looking at verified customer experiences can help you avoid low-quality products and choose one that’s both trustworthy and effective.
Certificate of Analysis
A Certificate of Analysis, or COA, is a lab report provided by a third-party testing facility that details exactly what’s in a CBD product—and reliable companies will include these on their websites. These lab reports break down the cannabinoid content, confirming how much CBD, THC and other compounds are present, so you can be sure the product contains what the label claims.
A COA also tests for contaminants like pesticides, heavy metals, mold and residual solvents, which could be harmful if consumed. Since the CBD industry is still largely unregulated, it’s important to find ways to verify a product’s safety and potency.

PharmD
Medically Reviewed
PharmD
CBD is a great natural wellness supplement, due to the way it interacts with the body’s endocannabinoid system, which helps the body maintain homeostasis (balance). Because it’s sort of a Swiss Army knife when it comes to overall wellness, CBD is an ideal compound to match with other vitamins and nutrients to make a more robust wellness product. CBDfx’s Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies are a great CBD-only product to use for daily wellness. Made with organically grown CBD, these gummies also feature delicious natural flavors and are a perfect addition to any morning health regime.
Directions for Best Results
The suggested serving size for our 1500mg Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies is two gummies (50mg). For our 3000mg Mixed Berry Broad Spectrum CBD Gummies, the recommended serving size is two gummies (100mg). For our high-potency 6000mg gummies, the recommended serving size is also two gummies.
If you’re new to CBD, we suggest that you try half a gummy serving (25mg) first to see how it affects you. If your CBD gummy works, great! You’ve found your effective CBD serving size. If not, then wait until the next day to try a higher CBD dosage. Remember that when you take CBD gummies and other edibles, it can take 30 minutes to two hours for you to feel the effects, depending on personal bioavailability factors, including height, weight, body mass, CBD tolerance, and other factors.
The Benefits of Original Mixed Berry Broad Spectrum CBD Gummies
CBD and gummies are a match made in Heaven. CBD, of course, is the incredibly popular health supplement that engages the body’s endocannabinoid system and produces powerful calming wellness benefits for the mind and body.**
There are many reasons that many CBD users prefer to enjoy their cannabidiol supplements in gummy form. Gummies are easily portable and you can discreetly take them whenever and wherever you like. CBD gummies also allow you to know exactly how much CBD you’re taking in every serving. This is especially important for those new to CBD, who are learning how to find their own personal Goldilocks serving: the amount of CBD that’s just right for them. Because we all have different bioavailability (the rate and amount of CBD that we absorb), CBD can affect us all differently. Having a reliable serving size takes all the guesswork out of CBD dosage. Again, keep in mind that our 1500mg bottle of CBD gummies contains gummies that are 25mg CBD each. Our 3000mg gummies contain 50mg CBD per gummy. And the big boi 6000mg gummies contain 100mg per gummy.
With 1500, 3000, and 6000 mg bottles available, our broad spectrum CBD gummies come in strengths for both beginners and veteran CBD users.
Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies vs Full Spectrum Mixed Berry CBD Gummies
Our Full Spectrum Mixed Berry CBD Gummies may taste the same, but they’re made with full spectrum CBD oil, with an added 3mg per serving of delta-9 THC. Our Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies are made with broad spectrum CBD, which means that all detectable levels of THC have been filtered out. Don’t confuse the two; these are not the same gummies.
Why Use Broad Spectrum CBD in CBD Gummies?
There are three types of CBD oil used in the various CBD products you’ll find online and in stores. When the CBD is initially extracted from the buds, leaves and stalks of the hemp plant, that unfiltered CBD oil is called full spectrum CBD. Full spectrum oil contains all of the cannabinoids (including CBD, CBG, CBN, CBC, and trace amounts of THC), terpenes, flavonoids, and healthy fatty acids of the hemp plant.
Although hemp, by law, must contain less than 0.3% THC content (which is likely not enough to get you high), many people still prefer to have those trace amounts of tetrahydrocannabinol removed. For one thing, this takes all the worry out of potentially having a false-positive result on a drug test. But also, many folks just don’t want THC in their system.
And so, a filtration process takes place that removes all detectable THC from the CBD oil. While this filtration process does remove a few of the other hemp compounds in the process, the resulting oil is still a robust and potent CBD oil, full of cannabinoids and other compounds. This CBD oil is called broad spectrum CBD. (Please note that even the tiniest traces of THC can build up over time in your system, potentially even with broad spectrum usage).
The benefit of these two kinds of CBD is that they allow you to experience the Entourage Effect. This is the phenomenon in which CBD and other hemp compounds don’t merely work in parallel with one another when consumed together; but instead, the various cannabinoids, terpenes and flavonoids actually enhance each other’s effects, making them work harder for you!
There is a third type of CBD, as well, which is called CBD isolate. The isolate form of CBD has all other hemp matter removed, except for the CBD, and is 99% pure CBD. This flavorless and scent-free version of CBD does work well with some bath products and CBD vape juices. But it does not provide the Entourage Effect.
We prefer broad spectrum CBD for our CBD gummies because it gives you the benefit of the Entourage Effect and a wide variety of cannabinoids, terpenes, and flavonoids to enhance your experience — with detectable levels of THC filtered out.
Other Natural Ingredients in Our Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies
Our Original Mixed Berry CBD Gummies contain no corn syrup, artificial colors or sweeteners, or animal-based ingredients. These gummies are made with organic tapioca syrup and cane sugar (only 1 gram), pectin, tri sodium citrate, citric acid, tomato lycopene (for color), and natural flavoring. With our CBD gummies, you can rest assured that you’re enjoying an all-natural, vegan CBD experience!
Why Are CBDfx Gummies the Best CBD Gummies?
At CBDfx, we insist on purity and potency in all of our CBD products. Every product we sell is made with organic hemp, with the CBD oil extracted by means of clean CO2. The result is a CBD product that is free of pesticides, heavy metals, GMOs, solvent residues, and other potentially harmful chemicals. All of this can be confirmed by lab tests, which we provide for all of our CBD products, conducted by independent, third-party laboratories. At CBDfx, your safety and satisfaction are our top priorities—which is why these gummies were recently named one of the Best CBD Gummies by Healthline!

Yes. While <a href="https://cbdfx.com/is-cbd-legal-in-my-state-2/"state-by-state CBD regulations can differ, hemp products with less than 0.3% THC content were made legal at the national level by the 2018 US Farm Bill.

Side effects from taking CBD are rare, but they can include reduced appetite, dry mouth, diarrhea, drowsiness, and fatigue. CBD can also interact with certain medications, so consult your physician before adding this or any other supplement to your wellness regimen.

There is no recommended CBD dosage for retail CBD products, including gummies. The FDA has only approved one prescription drug containing CBD, Epidiolex, which is used to treat rare forms of epilepsy.
Most CBD gummies contain between 10 milligrams of CBD per serving and 50 milligrams of CBD per serving (or higher), and manufacturer recommendations vary greatly from product to product.
Starting “slow and low” is important when it comes to CBD dosing, says Dr. Williams. “For those new to CBD, it’s wise to start with a low dose to gauge how your body reacts,” she adds. For retail CBD gummies, Dr. Williams considers a low dose of CBD to be 5 to 10 milligrams per serving, a moderate dose to be 10 to 25 milligrams of CBD per serving and a high dose to be 25 milligrams to 50 milligrams of CBD per serving.
As edibles, CBD gummies must go through the body’s digestive system and the liver in a process called first-pass metabolism before any CBD is absorbed into the body, which research suggests can lead to low bioavailability and delayed onset of effects. In fact, a 2023 article in the International Journal of Molecular Sciences suggests that just 9% to 13% of CBD taken orally, such as CBD gummies, is absorbed by the body.
“Because some CBD is lost during digestion, those [individuals] with moderate to severe symptoms may need to take a higher dose than initially anticipated,” says Dr. Williams. “If you’re using gummies for conditions like anxiety or chronic pain relief, you might require a dose of 30 milligrams to 50 milligrams to compensate for the reduced absorption rate.”
To assist with increased bioavailability, Dr. McNally recommends looking for a product that contains a water-soluble (or emulsion) form of CBD rather than a CBD oil. These details can be found on product packaging.
Always speak to a clinician familiar with CBD before adding CBD gummies to your health regimen, as the appropriate dose is highly individualized and based on specific needs.
How Do CBD Gummies Work?
Research into how CBD gummies and CBD in general work in the body is ongoing. The only CBD product that’s undergone rigorous clinical testing is the FDA-approved drug, Epidiolex.
However, studies suggest that certain CBD benefits are due to the cannabinoid’s interaction with the endocannabinoid system (ECS). The ECS may contribute to certain functions of the body’s central and peripheral nervous systems, including mood, behavior, seizure activity, male and female reproductive activity and digestion, among others.
The ECS features CB1 and CB2 cannabinoid receptors. Experts believe CBD and other cannabinoids and terpenes interact with these receptors to produce certain effects, such as reducing inflammation in the body, though additional research is necessary.
Many experts and retailers suggest full-spectrum and broad-spectrum CBD, which contain several naturally occurring cannabinoids and terpenes, may have an enhanced effect within the body through the synergistic entourage effect (when multiple cannabinoids interact with the ECS at once). However, a recent review in Pharmaceuticals concludes little conclusive research exists to support proof of the entourage effect, and further studies are necessary.

Dermatologist
Medically Reviewed
Dermatologist
I took one of these yummy gummies right before going to bed after a long day at work, in which my sleep cycle was a bit off. I had taken it right after dinner and right before bedtime, the time period that I typically recommend using the supplement. Right away, I started to see its ingredients working by getting me in the mood for bed and a good night’s rest. The following morning I woke up refreshed and not groggy at all, unlike some of the typical melatonin supplements I have taken in the past. I highly recommend it to anyone who has trouble falling asleep and wants a more natural supplement than the many recommended sleep products that are out there. It is worth giving it a shot to better be able to address the much-needed beauty rest we all need to carry out a productive day.
The melatonin gummies are locally made and also pleasant to digest. They contain melatonin, a natural ingredient in our pineal gland that helps regulate sleep and may assist with restlessness. Each gummy contains about 5 mg, which is just the adequate dose to make a difference. The blend features a unique formula of magnesium, which helps to relax, plus passion flower, chamomile, and lemon balm, which help to promote calmness and a relaxing state.
These gummies help me relax and calm down from a busy and stressful lifestyle.
Directions for Best Results
The suggested serving size for each of the 1500mg, 3000mg, and 6000mg strengths is two gummies, with the 3000mg version delivering double the CBD in every serving and the 6000mg delivering four times the CBD per serving.
We suggest, if you’re new to CBD, that you try half a 1500 strength gummy serving the first time around to see how it affects you. If your CBD gummy works, great! You have found your effective CBD serving size. If not, then wait until the next night to try a higher CBD dosage. Remember that when you take CBD edibles, it can take 30 minutes to two hours for you to feel the effects, depending on personal bioavailability factors, including height, weight, CBD tolerance, and other factors.
The Benefits of CBD Gummies for Sleep
Our CBD Gummies With Melatonin for Sleep are an effective natural sleep aid, formulated to give you a full night’s rest. With organic broad spectrum CBD, melatonin and all-natural ingredients, these delicious hemp gummies are a safe, effective and natural alternative to traditional sleeping pills, which can potentially become habitual and can leave you with an unpleasant hangover feeling in the morning. With CBD Sleep Gummies, you’ll awaken refreshed, renewed, and ready to take on your day!
Our CBD Gummies for Sleep begin with organic broad spectrum CBD. CBD (or cannabidiol) has many healthful properties due to its interaction with the body’s endocannabinoid system.** The endocannabinoid system helps to maintain homeostasis, or balance, in various systems and organs throughout the body, including the nervous system and brain. This helps the body to regulate such crucial functions as mood, memory, stress, immune, inflammation, appetite, pain, motor control and, yes, the body’s ability to regulate sleep cycles.
Using Melatonin With CBD
Melatonin is a natural hormone produced by the pineal gland in the brain and released into the bloodstream to help regulate the sleep-wake cycle. People have taken over-the-counter melatonin supplements for decades to complement the body’s sometimes inadequate production of this restful hormone. Melatonin is an ideal supplement to combine with CBD, since both ingredients simply help the body do what it’s already doing — only more efficiently. Make sure not to drive or operate heavy machinery when taking a melatonin product, as melatonin may cause drowsiness.
What Are Terpenes?
Terpenes are phytocompounds that give plants their scent, and do everything from encouraging pollination to warning away pests. For humans, these compounds have often been found to have beneficial wellness effects. In fact, terpenes form the basis of many essential oils, and are used in holistic treatments, such as aromatherapy. Some terpenes, such as those found in lavender and yes, cannabis, have been found to relax the mind and body.
Terpenes can also contribute to the Entourage Effect, which is a term used to describe the phenomenon by which CBD and other hemp compounds bolster each other’s effects when consumed together. This means the broad spectrum CBD in these vegan CBD gummies makes the sleep terpenes work harder for you and those very same terpenes make your calming CBD more effective, too.
Other Restful Ingredients
Our CBD Gummies with Melatonin for Sleep contain several restful ingredients to regulate sleep cycles and maximize your sleep experience. Magnesium has been shown to help the mind and body unwind and relax. Likewise, the botanical extracts used in these gummies — from passion flower, lemon balm, and chamomile — also give a calming effect that helps to prepare the body for rest.
With broad spectrum CBD, restful melatonin and magnesium, plus a potent blend of calming botanicals and sleep terpenes, our CBD Gummies for Sleep are a tasty way to send you off to Dreamland!

CBD capsules are a pill-like product you consume orally. The capsules consist of a casing, often made with gelatin (or a vegan or vegetarian substitute), and filling containing a specific amount of CBD.
CBD capsules are one of the many ways people can consume CBD, including oil tinctures, gummies and other edibles, and smoke or vapor inhalation.
What Are CBD Capsules Used for?
CBD capsules are popular for a few main reasons, according to Nick Jackowetz and Cam MacNeil, the chief scientific officer and chief commercial officer of Cirona Labs, which manufactures and processes cannabinoid ingredients.
“Capsules are flavorless, which can be a pleasant experience for a novice CBD user,” says Jackowetz. “They also contain a precise dose that doesn’t require any expertise to use and takes the guesswork out for the consumer.”
Many people are already used to taking pills, and most capsules are small, making them easy to add to your routine even when on the go.
How Do CBD Capsules Compare to CBD Oils?
Dosage
CBD capsules are handy if you want to take a specific dose each time. However, you are limited to the dosage of the product. For example, if one capsule contains 20 milligrams of CBD, you can’t adjust your dosage by 5 milligrams. You can only go up or down by 20 milligrams.
CBD oil tinctures, which come in bottles with a dropper, make it easier to find a middle-of-the-road dose. However, you also face greater variability in how much CBD you measure and ultimately consume with the dropper.
Time to Take Effect
CBD capsules take a bit longer to take effect than CBD oil tinctures. “With capsules, the CBD must travel through the stomach into the liver and gut to be metabolized,” says Laura Fuentes, a licensed compounding pharmacist and chief officer of science and innovation at Green Roads, a CBD company. Additional research into CBD’s absorption rate and bioavailability is necessary.
How Do CBD Capsules Compare to CBD Gummies?
CBD capsules and CBD gummies both go through first-pass digestion before taking effect, and more research is required regarding how long effects might be delayed or blunted by this process. However, while gummies often contain additional flavors and ingredients, capsules usually have a shorter ingredient list, containing only CBD and the vegan, vegetarian or regular gelatin casing of the capsule.
An individual’s personal preferences determine whether the taste and aftertaste of a CBD gummy is palatable. For those who prefer flavorless options, capsules may be a more appealing choice. CBD capsules and gummies are often available in similar potencies and types.

Do CBD gummies relieve pain?
CBD has anti-inflammatory and analgesic (pain relieving) properties, which may make it an effective treatment for certain types of pain. Some studies have shown CBD has promise in relieving pain, but further studies on humans are needed.
Which form of CBD is best for pain?
There isn’t a “best” form of CBD for pain, as it varies depending on individual preferences and needs. Some people may find relief with CBD creams while others may prefer to take CBD oils or gummies orally.
Are CBD gummies good for pain?
More research is needed to understand how CBD interacts in the body to address pain, and it isn’t yet approved by the FDA for pain management specifically. However, some scientific evidence suggests CBD may be beneficial for managing certain types of pain. Consult a health care provider before adding it to your regimen, and prioritize CBD brands that participate in clinical research on CBD use for pain.
How much CBD is good for pain relief?
CBD products range significantly in potency, and responses to the cannabinoid vary per person. Most CBD product manufacturers recommend starting with a low dose and gradually increasing as needed. It’s important to follow the manufacturer instructions on product labels to ensure safe and effective use.
What is the best time of day to take CBD gummies for pain?
There are currently no medical recommendations about the best timing for taking CBD gummies. It’s best to follow any instructions on the container of your CBD gummies for advice about timing of doses and whether they should be taken with food or water.

Experts advise newcomers to start with a low dose of CBD oil, such as 25 milligrams a day, and gradually increase their dose to a level that provides the desired effects. It’s best to navigate this process under the guidance of a qualified health care provider, as reactions to CBD can vary per person.
For CBD oil to take effect, it must first be digested in a process called first-pass digestion. Preliminary research suggests consuming CBD oil with high-fat foods may increase CBD’s bioavailability, but further human trials are needed. CBD tinctures are taken under the tongue and are absorbed by the mucous membranes, which may mean they take effect more quickly, though more scientific evidence is necessary to support this theory.
How to Read CBD Labels
CBD products are not currently regulated by the FDA as dietary supplements, so it’s difficult to determine a product’s safety and efficacy. However, knowing how to read a label can help ensure consumers understand the ingredients and potential benefits or risks of using a certain CBD product.
Statement of identity: This information indicates a product’s intended use. When shopping for CBD products, check the label to ensure you’re buying the specific form you’re looking for, such as cream, edible or tincture.
Composition: The content of a CBD product should indicate amounts of CBD per serving and CBD type (broad spectrum, full spectrum or isolate).
Health-related claims: These claims may also indicate to a consumer the intended use of a CBD product and its possible effects. Consider whether a CBD product claims to offer specific benefits, such as promoting sleep, pain relief or reducing anxiety.
Nutritional content: This information may be useful for individuals with health or dietary concerns, as some CBD labels may display certain nutritional claims. For example, some product labels may indicate that a product is low-calorie or gluten-free. This information should also include additional ingredients such as carrier oils and natural or artificial flavorings.
Third-party testing: All CBD products should be third-party laboratory tested to verify that the product contains no more than 0.3% THC by dry weight. If a product has been third-party tested, it should come with a certificate of analysis (COA) that confirms the amount of CBD the product contains and discloses whether the product contains additional cannabinoids, such as THC, as well as levels of contaminants like heavy metals, pesticides or biological impurities.
Choosing the Best CBD Oil Strength
There’s no standard dose or potency when it comes to taking CBD oil. Effects vary from person to person and depend on the type of CBD used, as well as other factors, such as height, weight and metabolic function. Furthermore, the effective dose of CBD oil may change based on the intended use—for example, whether it’s being used to support sleep, improve pain levels or reduce anxiety. More research is needed to determine standard effective doses and potencies of CBD oil.
“CBD oil is used—without much supportive evidence—for the self-medication of various conditions, including pain and anxiety,” says Dr. Piomelli. “If someone decides to try it, I would recommend to start with a low daily dose (50 milligrams maximum) and make sure to monitor themselves for side effects like somnolence (drowsiness), fatigue and diarrhea. I wouldn’t exceed a daily dose of 250 milligrams, nor would I take it for more than two to three weeks.”
How Much CBD Oil Should I Take?
The amount of CBD oil an individual should take varies based on the potency of the oil, the type of CBD it uses and desired effects. What’s more, CBD oil effects and absorption rates depend on additional factors, such as a person’s body weight, height and individual metabolism.
Experts generally recommend starting with a low dose and potency and building from there to find the ideal CBD oil dose for you.
How Long Does CBD Oil Take to Work?
Some research suggests holding CBD oil underneath the tongue may lead to absorption through the bloodstream, meaning the effects may be felt sooner than other delivery methods, but additional studies are needed to support these claims.
Meanwhile, CBD oil that is swallowed may take as long as 30 minutes to four hours to take effect, according to Dr. Piomelli. Additionally, research indicates that CBD bioavailability increases when consumed with a high-fat or high-calorie meal rather than consuming CBD alone or on an empty stomach.
“A full stomach speeds up absorption, but it could still take hours for CBD to be fully absorbed,” adds Dr. Piomelli.

The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) doesn’t approve or test retail CBD products for quality or potency, meaning consumers are responsible for selecting the best product to meet their needs. Further complicating matters, some retail CBD products have been found to be mislabeled regarding potency, as well as purity. A 2017 study in JAMA Network indicates that, among 84 independently tested retail CBD products, 26% contained less CBD than the label claimed, and 43% contained more CBD compared to the label. Knowing the signs of a high-quality CBD product for anxiety and stress is therefore extremely important prior to purchase or consumption.
Factors that may indicate a product is high quality include:
- USDA-certified organic seal
- Label indicates the product is non-GMO and contains all-natural ingredients
- Certificate of analysis (COA) is easily accessible, demonstrating potency and safety
- Company doesn’t make unsupported health claims
- Manufacturer provides specific dosage information
- Whether the CBD is processed to be water soluble
A health care professional familiar with using CBD for anxiety may be able to help you choose the highest quality product for your needs.
Types of CBD for Anxiety
Retail CBD products are available in three forms: CBD isolate, broad-spectrum CBD and full-spectrum CBD, which differ based on extraction and processing methods. While CBD isolate contains exclusively CBD, broad-spectrum and full-spectrum CBD contain additional cannabinoids and active plant constituents, such as terpenes. Meanwhile, broad-spectrum CBD is processed to contain non-detectable levels of THC while full-spectrum CBD contains all naturally occurring cannabinoids, including up to 0.3% THC by dry weight.
Personal preference comes into play regarding the type of CBD product an individual prefers, from beverage to edible gummy to oil and more.
Recommended CBD Dosage for Anxiety
There’s no established CBD dosage for anxiety management. Manufacturers typically include a recommended dose on the product packaging and/or website, and CBD consumers should read these instructions carefully.
CBD may also be absorbed more effectively when taken with food, according to Dr. McNally, which may be important when considering one’s optimal dosage. Experts generally recommend starting at a low dosage and increasing that amount slowly over time to avoid unwanted side effects.
CBD Risks and Side Effects
According to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA), orally administered CBD products like CBD gummies and CBD oils may cause uncomfortable or harmful side effects, including:
- Diarrhea
- Nausea
- Decreased mental alertness/sedation
- Fatigue
- Mood changes, such as irritability
- Liver injury
- Male reproductive harm
- Drug interactions
Always speak to a health care provider familiar with your medical history and any medications you’re taking before adding a retail CBD product to your wellness regimen to limit the potential for negative side effects.

Cannabidiol (CBD) is one of the latest ingredients to take the health world by storm. Derived from both hemp and cannabis plants, CBD, as well as other cannabinoids, spark curiosity in some and skepticism in others. Meanwhile, a lack of federal regulations surrounding the substance in the U.S. makes it particularly challenging to parse fact from fiction when it comes to consumer health and safety.
We at Forbes Health take our role of providing you with accurate, research-supported, and expert-backed information very seriously—especially when it comes to murky topics like CBD and other hemp and cannabis cannabinoids.
The Legal Landscape of CBD
Hemp is defined as a cannabis plant that contains no more than 0.3% THC by dry weight. Meanwhile, marijuana is a cannabis plant that contains more than 0.3% THC by dry weight. Any cannabis plant containing more than 0.3% THC is considered non-hemp cannabis—or marijuana—under federal law.
The Farm Bill Act, among other changes, removed hemp’s classification as marijuana under the Controlled Substances Act, effectively making hemp-derived products legal. However, the 2018 Farm Bill explicitly preserved the U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s authority over hemp products. Therefore, hemp products must meet any applicable FDA requirements and standards just like any other FDA-regulated product under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FD&C Act).
At a minimum, states have approved the use of FDA-approved products that contain less than 0.3% THC. Some states have a cap of 0.05% THC while others have legalized marijuana entirely. Some states expressly permit the use of CBD gummies that fall within these guidelines. This variance puts local regulations in misalignment with federal guidelines. As of right now, CBD is neither approved for inclusion in food nor as a dietary supplement.
Our Stance on CBD
It is our editorial policy to not make unsubstantiated or unscientific claims in our content or recommend products derived from marijuana. Similar to our other areas of health coverage, all health claims must be attributable to a scientific study in order to align with requirements of the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), and marijuana-derived products remain illegal in most states and have not been removed from the federal list of controlled substances.
Generally speaking, the use of hemp-derived CBD is legal under the Farm Bill Act. In our coverage of such products:
- We will not recommend products that derive CBD from non-hemp sources (sources containing more than 0.3% THC by dry weight).
- We will not make unsubstantiated claims that cannot be scientifically validated.
- We will not recommend CBD products as dietary supplements or as part of a healthy diet or wellness regimen.
It is our goal and privilege to serve as your trusted source for safe and accurate CBD information. When reading any of our CBD content, know that it was carefully written, edited and fact-checked prior to publication. We physically review and third-party lab-test CBD products where appropriate to confirm their potency, quality and safety. What’s more, we are paying constant attention to the legal landscape of CBD and cannabis to ensure our content accurately reflects any changes that should occur.

Research suggests the cannabinoids in topical CBD creams may be absorbed more efficiently by the body through the skin, rather than passing through digestion, as is the case with orally ingested CBD products.
Although research in the U.S. is ongoing, preliminary studies show that topical CBD cream may be beneficial when it comes to treating chronic pain conditions, such as arthritis. However, additional well-designed human clinical trials are needed, as much of the existing research is based on animal studies or anecdotal results.
One small, placebo-controlled 2020 study in Current Pharmaceutical Biotechnology examined the use of topical CBD in 29 participants with peripheral neuropathy, a chronic pain condition caused by nerve damage. The results showed that the 15 participants using topical CBD oil experienced significantly less pain compared to the 14 participants using the placebo after four weeks.
Another 2018 study with over 300 participants with knee pain from osteoarthritis found a transdermal synthetic CBD gel significantly improved patients’ worst pain score and physical function averages. These patients were treated with 350 milligrams of CBD gel per day for 12 weeks.
Additionally, some research suggests that the anti-inflammatory properties of CBD cream may help to improve certain skin conditions such as acne and eczema.

Blends the calming benefits of CBD with the invigorating sensation of menthol. Elevate your wellness routine with this trending fusion of natural remedies. Embrace the cooling comfort. Discover CBD Lotion + Menthol and feel revitalized today!"
CBD Creams and Topicals Side Effects
CBD itself is safe and well tolerated, and it has no risks of abuse or dependence, according to the World Health Organization.
“Additionally, using CBD topically reduces the likelihood of experiencing side effects typically associated with CBD use, such as drowsiness, fatigue and diarrhea,” says Dr. Milanes.
Milanes and Fuentes warn that while CBD itself might be safe, there is a chance you might be allergic or sensitive to another ingredient in a CBD topical, which could cause adverse effects. To avoid unpleasant reactions, they suggest reading ingredient lists carefully.
Phan also recommends talking to your doctor before using CBD if you’re on any medications— especially blood pressure medications because CBD can also lower blood pressure.
Is CBD Cream Safe?
Because CBD creams aren’t regulated by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as topical drug products, it’s difficult to determine their safety and efficacy as a product category. However, the American Academy of Dermatology (AAD) reports that topical CBD products may be effective in treating conditions including acne, psoriasis and eczema with few or no side effects. Ultimately, safety and efficacy depend on the specific CBD cream product and its formulation.

Which CBD gummy brands are best for sleep?
The best CBD gummy brands for sleep offer minimal side effects and send all their products to a third-party laboratory for testing. Our list exclusively includes products that are third-party tested for quality and efficacy and may be a great place to start your search for CBD gummies for sleep.
How many CBD gummies for sleep should you take?
Follow the instructions on the packaging of the CBD gummies you plan to take, as dose often varies from product to product.
Dr. Ratner suggests starting with a low dose of 10 to 20 milligrams of CBD to first see how you react. If it goes well, you can slowly increase your dose as needed.
Do CBD gummies for sleep have intoxicating effects?
CBD itself does not create intoxicating effects. The “high” associated with cannabis comes from the cannabinoid delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC). Full-spectrum CBD products can contain up to 0.3% THC by dry weight, which isn’t enough to have intoxicating effects. If you want to avoid THC altogether, look for broad-spectrum or CBD isolate products instead.
What happens if you eat expired CBD gummies?
“Once it has passed its expiration date, the CBD will start losing its potency and eventually lose its effectiveness entirely,” says Heifitz. “You might notice a change in the taste of the gummy as well, but nothing bad should happen to you.”
Heifitz recommends following the storage instructions listed on your chosen CBD product and minding its expiration date to maintain both its shelf life and potency.
How long do CBD gummies last?
Research suggests that the effects of CBD can last up to two to four hours after consumption.

- It is important to note that our naturally occurring Hemp-derived THC content is federally compliant under The Agricultural Act, a.k.a. The Farm Bill, which Congress passed in late 2018: defining the federal compliant maximum THC limit of 0.3% by weight of the final product. Please check with your state as the laws vary state by state outside of Congress passing The Agricultural Act, a.k.a. The Farm Bill of 2018.
WARNING: Always follow applicable state laws and do not purchase if unlawful to purchase or possess in your state. Not for sale to persons under the age of 21. Do not drive or operate heavy equipment after use. Prior to use, consult your doctor if you have any medical conditions, take any medications, or are pregnant or breastfeeding. These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to treat, cure, diagnose, or prevent any disease. This product is derived from hemp. Hemp products may cause the user to fail a drug test. Contains less than 0.3% hemp-derived delta-9 THC; federally compliant under the 2018 Farm Bill. Reproductive harm www.P65Warnings.ca.gov.
Healthline Approved
More than 200 million people turn to Healthline every month for expert and trustworthy health information. To help you make informed decisions for your health and well-being, Healthline’s Brand and Content Integrity Team evaluates brands and products to:
- Establish that safety and efficacy standards have been addressed by the product manufacturer
- Fact-check health claims
- Assess brand integrity
Healthline editors then choose brands and products to feature in product reviews. Products that pass vetting and are featured in Healthline articles are eligible for a “Healthline Approved” badge. None of Healthline’s product reviews are intended as medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

argos_summary: Keoni CBD gummies are made from 100% organically grown hemp and are marketed as full‑spectrum, but third‑party testing shows they are actually broad‑spectrum with THC removed. Each gummy contains 20–25 mg of CBD, and the brand offers 20‑ and 40‑gummy bottles for $54.99 and $64.99, with a subscribe‑and‑save discount. Experts note the gummies are convenient, have a longer onset than oils, and may aid sleep, anxiety, and pain, but caution that COAs are over a year old and users should consult a healthcare provider, especially if on medications. Consumer reviews are mixed, citing good taste and effectiveness but poor customer service and refund issues, and the company’s BBB rating is low. The article also explains the difference between full‑, broad‑, and isolate‑CBD, the importance of third‑party testing, and the legal limits on THC in hemp products.
